item.description:
The May meeting of the Boston MySQL User Group will feature Giuseppe Maxia and Kaj Arno, 40% of the community team from MySQL/Sun(/Oracle). Giuseppe will speak about the features, performance, and roadmap of 5.4, the newest version of MySQL.

Abstract:
"MySQL 5.4, the surprise announcement at the MySQL Conference 2009, is a
special edition with one specific purpose: performance.
This session will show how MySQL 5.4 compares to the previous versions,
with some benchmarks and use cases."

------------------------

Here is the URL for MIT's Map with the location of this building:
http://whereis.mit.ed...

This map shows the MBTA Kendall Stop:
http://whereis.mit.ed...
(the stop is in red on that map, and you can see E51 in the bottom right)

Here are the URL's for the parking lots:
http://whereis.mit.ed...
http://whereis.mit.ed...

Free pizza and soda will be served, so please RSVP accurately.

To RSVP anonymously, please login to the Meetup site with the e-mail address "admin at sheeri dot com" and the password "guest".

For more information, see: http://mysql.meetup.c...
item.name: The Boston MySQL May Meetup
